solution_line_template: At the end of 2018, the tree will grow {initial_height_2017} x {growth_percent_numerator}/{growth_percent_denominator} = <<{initial_height_2017}*{growth_percent_numerator}/{growth_percent_denominator}={growth_2018}>>{growth_2018} meters more.
Thus, its height at the end of 2018 is {initial_height_2017} + {growth_2018} = <<{initial_height_2017}+{growth_2018}={height_2018}>>{height_2018} meters.

At the end of 2019, the tree will grow {height_2018} x {growth_percent_numerator}/{growth_percent_denominator} = <<{height_2018}*{growth_percent_numerator}/{growth_percent_denominator}={growth_2019}>>{growth_2019} meters more.
So, its height at the end of 2019 is {height_2018} + {growth_2019} = <<{height_2018}+{growth_2019}={height_2019}>>{height_2019} meters.
Therefore, the tree has grown {height_2019} - {initial_height_2017} = <<{height_2019}-{initial_height_2017}={total_growth}>>{total_growth} meters.
